{{also|Treffen}} ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/ˈtrɛfə(n)/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-treffen.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|nl|ɛfən}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|nl|dum|treffen}}, from {{der|nl|gmh|treffen}}, from {{cog|goh|treffan}}. Replaced rare {{cog|dum|drepen}}, from {{cog|odt|drepan}}. Both ultimately descend from {{der|nl|gem-pro|*drepaną}}. ====Verb==== {{nl-verb}} # {{lb|nl|transitive}} to [[hit]], [[strike]] #: {{ux|nl|Het leek alsof ik door een [[mokerslag]] was '''getroffen'''.|It felt as if I was '''hit''' by a sledge.}} # {{lb|nl|transitive}} to [[find]] (by chance), [[hit upon]], to [[encounter]] # {{lb|nl|intransitive}} to be [[opportune]] # {{lb|nl|transitive}} to [[meet]] with # {{lb|nl|transitive}} to [[achieve]], [[accomplish]] #: {{rfex|nl}} # {{lb|nl|transitive}} to [[feel]], [[come]] to [[believe]] #: {{rfex|nl}} =====Inflection===== {{nl-conj-st|class=3|tref|trof|troffen|treffe|troffe}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|nl|aantreffen}} * {{l|nl|betreffen}} * {{l|nl|overtreffen}} * {{l|nl|trefwoord}} ===Etymology 2=== Gerund of the verb {{m|nl|treffen}}. ====Noun==== {{nl-noun|n|-s|treffentje}} # [[encounter]] #: {{ux|nl|In de hoofdstad Quito zijn al enkele dagen demonstraties tegen bezuinigingen op de politiesalarissen, waarbij het tot gewapend '''treffen''' tussen het leger en de rebellerende agenten is gekomen.|In the capital Quito there have been already, for several days, demonstrations against budget cuts of police salaries, which has led to armed ''encounters'' between the military and the rebelling police officers.}} # [[meeting]] ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|treffen}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|de|treffan}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*drepaną}}, whence also {{cog|en|drub}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈtʁɛfɱ̩/|/ˈtʁɛfən/}} * {{audio|de|De-treffen.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-treffen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=4|trifft|traf|getroffen|past subjunctive=träfe}} # {{lb|de|transitive|or|reflexive}} to [[meet]]; to [[encounter]] # {{lb|de|transitive|or|intransitive}} to [[hit]]; to [[strike]] # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[affect]]; to [[concern]] # {{lb|de|intransitive|or|reflexive|colloquial|often with “[[gut#German|gut]]” or “[[schlecht]]”}} to [[hit the mark]]; to [[suit]]; to be [[convenient]], [[fortunate]] #: {{ux|de|Das '''trifft''' sich schlecht.|translation=That’s unfortunate.|inline=1}} ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|treff|traf|getroffen|h||triff|träf|a|a}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|antreffen}} * {{l|de|auftreffen}} * {{l|de|betreffen}} * {{l|de|den Nagel auf den Kopf treffen}} * {{l|de|eintreffen}} * {{l|de|übertreffen}} * {{l|de|ins Schwarze treffen}} * {{l|de|Treffen}} * {{l|de|treffend}} * {{l|de|Treffer}} * {{l|de|trefflich}} * {{l|de|Treffpunkt}} * {{l|de|treffsicher}} * {{l|de|Treff}} * {{l|de|triftig}} * {{l|de|vortrefflich}} * {{l|de|zutreffen}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from early modern {{der|lb|de|-}} or late {{der|lb|gmh|treffen}}, from {{der|lb|goh|treffan}}, from {{der|lb|gem-pro|*drepaną}}. Compare {{cog|nl|treffen}}, which was borrowed in the 15th century. The native Luxemburgish form would be {{m|lb||*driefen}} (or {{m|lb||*dreffen}}); the verb is not inherited anywhere in [[Central Franconian]]. Further cognates include {{cog|en|drib}}, {{cog|is|drepa}}, {{cog|sv|dräpa}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/ˈtʀæfən/}} ===Verb=== {{lb-verb|trëfft|getraff}} # {{lb|lb|transitive}} to [[hit]], to [[beat]], to [[strike]] # {{lb|lb|transitive|or|reflexive}} to [[meet]] # {{lb|lb|transitive}} to [[affect]], to [[touch]] ====Conjugation==== {{lb-conj-irregular|treff|trëff|treff|getraff|hunn}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|lb|betreffen}} * {{l|lb|iwwertreffen}} * {{l|lb|untreffen}} * {{l|lb|zoutreffen}}
